description:
Citizenship

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12612 Birth statistics

Definition:
Until 31 December 1974, children born within marriage were
Germans only if their father was a German whereas children
born inside marriage to a German mother and a foreign father
did not acquire German citizenship by birth.
From 1975 to 1999 a child acquired German citizenship by
birth if the father or the mother were German. Until 30 June
1993 this applied only to children born inside marriage;
children born outside marriage were Germans only if the
mother was a German. Since 1 July 1993 a child born outside
marriage to a foreign mother and a German father also
acquires German citizenship by birth. The acquisition of
German citizenship may be claimed as soon as paternity has
effectively been established in accordance with German law.
Part of the children shown in the table who have foreign
citizenship and parents not married to each other will
therefore hold German citizenship later, after a German has
acknowledged paternity or a court has established a German's
paternity. Since 2000, children are shown as German citizens
if their German father's acknowledgement of paternity was
registered when they were born.
On 1 January 2000, a new citizenship law became effective.
In accordance with that law, not only children whose father
or mother are Germans acquire German citizenship by birth
but also children of foreign parents if one parent has been
legally and ordinarily resident in Germany for eight years
and holds an unlimited residence permit or either holds a
residence permit as a citizen of Switzerland.
